DOC.brief_summary: A new male-specific dog-allergen-component has been found (Can f 5) which indicates possible differences in allergic reactions to male and female dogs. This has not yet been tested in real life. The aim is to test if sensitization only to the male-dog specific allergen-component, Can f 5, results in a positive skin prick test (SPT) to male dog extract and not female dog extract. In addition, the investigators want to investigate if allergic symptoms only occur when exposed to the male dog extract by conjunctival provocation.
DOC.brief_title: Precision Allergy: Separate Allergies to Male and Female Dogs
DOC.criteria: Participants in the COPSAC 2000 cohort Positive component test (>0.3 ISU) to Can f 1, Can f 2, Can f 3 or Can f 5 Uncontrolled asthma Eyesurgery within the past 6 months Antihistamine allergy and others
